required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study to Determine the Efficacy of Durvalumab in Combination With Chemotherapy in Completely Resected Stage II-III Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Multicenter, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Determine the Efficacy of Adjuvant Durvalumab in Combination With Platinum-based Chemotherapy in Completely Resected Stage II-III NSCLC (MERMAID-1)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase III, randomized, parallel-arm, placebo controlled, double blind, multicenter study assessing the efficacy and safety of durvalumab versus placebo following SoC chemotherapy in patients with completely resected stage II-III NSCLC who are MRD+ post surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients who have no evidence of disease recurrence confirmed by CT and/or MRI and are confirmed to meet all eligibility criteria will be randomized 1:1 to durvalumab + Standard of care (SoC) chemotherapy or placebo + Standard of care (SoC) chemotherapy arm.
The primary objective of this study is to assess the efficacy of durvalumab +SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo+ SoC chemotherapy in terms of DFS measured in MRD+ patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Disease free survival (DFS) in MRD+ analysis set (using Investigator assessments according to RECIST 1.1)
primary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy as measured by DFS in MRD+ patients

secondary_outcome.measure: DFS in FAS (using Investigator assessments according to RECIST 1.1)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy as measured by DFS in all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: DFS (using BICR assessments according to RECIST 1.1) in MRD+ analysis set and in FAS
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy as measured by DFS in MRD+ patients and in all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: OS in MRD+ analysis set and in FAS
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the efficacy of durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy as measured by OS in MRD+ patients and in all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EORTC QLQ-LC13 score
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning, and HRQoL in MRD+ patients treated with durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to deterioration in EORTC QLQ-LC13 score
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning, and HRQoL in MRD+ patients treated with durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EORTC QLQ-C30 score
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning and HRQoL in MRD+ patients treated with durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to deterioration in EORTC QLQ-C30 score
secondary_outcome.description: To assess patient-reported symptoms, functioning, and HRQoL in MRD+ patients treated with durvalumab + SoC chemotherapy compared to placebo + SoC chemotherapy

arm_group.description: Intravenous administration of Experimental and Standard of Care Therapy
Intravenous administration of Placebo and Standard of Care Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Capable of giving signed informed consent, which includes a mandatory genetic informed consent and compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent forms (ICFs) and study protocol
2. Age ≥18 years at the time of screening
3. Diagnosis of histologically confirmed NSCLC (WHO 2015 classification) with resectable (stage II-III) disease
4. Complete resection of the primary NSCLC
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Postoperative imaging demonstrating unequivocal evidence of disease recurrence or tissue biopsy-proven disease recurrence
2. EGFR-mutant and/or ALK-translocation
3. Mixed small cell and NSCLC histology
4. Received any prior adjuvant therapy for NSCLC or any prior exposure to durvalumab

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data from AstraZeneca group of companies sponsored clinical trials via the request portal. All request will be evaluated as per the AZ disclosure commitment: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: AstraZeneca will meet or exceed data availability as per the commitments made to the EFPIA Pharma Data Sharing Principles. For details of our timelines, please rerefer to our disclosure commitment at: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: When a request has been approved AstraZeneca will provide access to the de-identified individual patient-level data in an approved sponsored tool . Signed Data Sharing Agreement (non-negotiable contract for data accessors) must be in place before accessing requested information. Additionally, all users will need to accept the terms and conditions of the SAS MSE to gain access. For additional details, please review the Disclosure Statements at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
